error.signature: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /path/to/lib.so: libdep.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
error.regex: cannot open shared object file|UnsatisfiedLinkError.*\.so.*No such file

verdict.summary: A native shared library (.so file) that a JNI binding depends on cannot be found on the system. The primary .so loads but its transitive native dependencies are missing from LD_LIBRARY_PATH or the system library directories.

dead_ends.action: Installing only the main library without its native dependencies
dead_ends.why_fails: Native libraries have their own dependency chains (visible via ldd). If a dependency .so is missing, the main .so cannot be loaded even if it is present. All transitive native dependencies must be satisfied.

dead_ends.action: Creating symlinks to random library versions to satisfy the dependency
dead_ends.why_fails: Symlinking to an incompatible version (e.g., libfoo.so.2 -> libfoo.so.3) may load but can cause segfaults or undefined behavior due to ABI incompatibility. The correct version must be installed.

workarounds.action: Use ldd to identify all missing native dependencies and install them
workarounds.how: 1. Run 'ldd /path/to/libjni.so' to see all native dependencies and which are missing ('not found'). 2. For each missing library, find the package: 'apt-file search libmissing.so' or 'yum whatprovides */libmissing.so*'. 3. Install the package: 'apt-get install libmissing-dev'. 4. Run 'ldconfig' to refresh the library cache. 5. Verify with 'ldd' that all dependencies are now resolved.

workarounds.action: In Docker containers, install native dependencies in the Dockerfile and ensure the correct base image
workarounds.how: 1. Use a base image that includes common native libraries (e.g., eclipse-temurin:17 instead of alpine variants). 2. If using Alpine, install gcompat or musl equivalents. 3. Add RUN apt-get install -y libfoo-dev to the Dockerfile. 4. Run RUN ldconfig after installing libraries. 5. Test the container locally before deploying.

leads_to.condition: when the native library loads but JNI symbol resolution fails due to version mismatch

preceded_by.condition: when investigating a JNI error reveals missing transitive native dependencies

frequently_confused_with.distinction: JNI error is a broader category including symbol resolution and JNI API misuse; native library not found specifically means a .so file is missing from the filesystem or library path
